name: (2-aminoethoxy)acetic acid

However, having an amino (-NH2) group generally increases the melting point due to possibilities for hydrogen bonding (+50). An ether group (C-O-C) might slightly lower the melting point due to the ether oxygen's branching effect (-5). The carboxylic acid group (-COOH) greatly increases the melting point because of the strong hydrogen bonding and dipole-dipole interactions it can participate in with neighboring molecules (+120). Combining these effects, we predict the melting point adjustment.
